reference.title: Opening and changing a terminology list

section.indexterm: terminology listsmoving terms to another list
section.p: You open a list to work with it, for example, to copy entries from the terminology list to a dictionary or to another list.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The list window that contains the terminology list to be opened is active.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p:
Select:
The terminology list to be opened
Open from the File menu

One of the following windows is displayed, depending on the type of list selected:
Work with Found Terms List
Work with New Terms List
Edit Exclusion List See , the Work with New Terms List window, as an example.
The Edit Exclusion List window is explained in . windowsWork with New Terms List Work with New Terms List windowFigure shows Work with New Terms List window

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: In the list box you see the terms contained in the opened new or found terms list.

plentry.pd:
The meaning of the processing symbols in this row is as follows: Figure shows Shows all terms in the list. Figure shows Shows all terms not marked for any processing. Figure shows Shows all terms to be deleted. Figure shows Shows all terms to be added to a dictionary. Figure shows Shows all terms to be added to an exclusion list.
The contents of the list box depends on the processing selected for the terms and the processing symbol selected in this row.

section.p: You can select and mark one or more terms in order to specify the processing:

plentry.pd: Select this button to remove this term from the lists.
Select this button to add this term to a dictionary. This takes you to the Mark Term for Dictionary window where you specify further parameters and then return to this window (see ).

Select this button to add this term to an exclusion list. You can select the exclusion list to be filled from the list box, which contains all available exclusion lists. You can also type a new name for an exclusion list in order to create a new one.
Click this option to unmark a previously marked term.

section.p: The view symbol preceding a term represents the processing you have selected for it.

To begin the processing of the selected terms, you click Process. If you marked any term to add to a dictionary, you can specify more options in the Mark Term for Dictionary window (see ). When the processing is completed, the list contains the remaining terms for which no processing was specified.
The marked terms need not be processed immediately. To save the list in its current status of marking, click Save.
To leave the terms list in its original status, click Cancel.

section.title: Results
section.p: If you selected Process, the terminology list is changed depending on your selections. If you made changes to any dictionary or exclusion list, they are active during the next analysis or translation of a document.
If you selected Save, the terminology list is saved including the new processing marks.
If you selected the Cancel button, the terminology list remains unchanged.
